column3:
Once upon a time, there was a boy named Freddy.   And Freddy loved his mom very much, and
ewlinehis mom loved him very much too.  One day, Freddy went outside to ride his bike.  On the
ewlineway out, his mother told him, "Remember to wear your helmet," and Freddy grabbed his
ewlinehelmet and met his friends outside.  When he was putting on his helmet, his friends told
ewlinehim, "Helmets are for girls!  You're not cool if you wear a helmet!"  Freddy thought about
ewlinewhat his mom told him, but he wanted to be cool like his friends, and he took off his
ewlinehelmet.
ewline
ewlineFreddy and his friends went on a long adventure, and they rode all the way to the top of
ewlinethe largest hill in their neighborhood.  Looking down, Freddy was scared.  He had never
ewlineridden down this hill before.  His friends said, "What are you, scared?"  Freddy did not
ewlinewant to come off as scared.  He hopped on his bicycle, and down he went.  Freddy started
ewlinespeeding up, going very, very fast.  He pressed his brakes, but oh no, his brakes weren't
ewlineworking.  Freddy, speeding down the hill, did not know what to do.  He got to the end of
ewlinethe hill and slammed right into a tree.  He awoke the next day in the hospital.
ewline
ewlineAt the hospital, his mother was there.  Freddy opened his eyes and told his mom the whole
ewlinestory.  He told her how we would never do that again, and how he would always wear his
ewlinehelmet.  His mom gave him a big kiss on the forehead, and Freddy knew his mother was right
ewlinein the beginning.  She didn't have to say it.  In the end, Freddy learned that it's
ewlineimportant to not care what other people think, and those that think you're not cool
ewlinebecause you wear a helmet are the ones that aren't cool in the first place.
column9: one: What's the name of the main character in the story?
column14: multiple: In which two places is this story located?
column19: multiple: What two things do the main character's friends say to him?
column20: Freddy is a girl! and "You're a little baby!"
column21: Helmets are for girls!  You're not cool if you wear a helmet! and "What are you, scared?"
column22: Did your mommy buy you that helmet?  and "Helmets are for girls!  You're not cool if you wear a helmet!"
column23: Quit being such a cry baby and "What are you, scared?"
